Class EditCustomerHandler

java.lang.Object
EditCustomerHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
HttpHandler
public class EditCustomerHandler extends Object implements HttpHandler
EditCustomerHandler class This class handles HTTP requests for editing a customer's details.

It first checks if the user is logged in using the LoggedIn() method from the HttpHelper class. If the user is not logged in, they are redirected to the login page using the redirect() method from the HttpHelper class.

If logged in and the request method is GET and an ID is provided as a query parameter, the ID value is extracted using a key value pair. The ID value is assigned to a variable and used to list the customer's details in a pre-populated HTTP form using the CustomerDAO class and it's FindCustomer() method. Response header 200 is sent.

If logged in and the request method is POST, form data is extracted as an ArrayList of Key Value Pairs using the HttpHelper class's getKVPairs() method. The Key Value Pairs are split and values are extracted and assigned to variables related to the customer object. The customer information is updated using these variables, the CustomerDAO and it's UpdateCustomer() method. The user is redirected to the menu using the redirect() method from the HttpHelper class

Since:
Corretto-17
